alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 22 at 6:14AM MST until March 22 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST /1 PM MDT/ TODAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Periods of rain and snow will continue early this morning, with snow levels around 7000 feet. Snow levels will continue to fall from west to east through the morning hours. Periods of snow will continue through the morning, becoming more showery during the afternoon. Expect snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches above 6500 feet, with 8 to 12 inches above 8500 feet. Southwest winds gusting as high as 40 mph early, slowly decreasing through the day. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until noon MST /1 PM MDT/ today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Additional snow forecast from 6 AM Today to noon Today: Doney Park 1 to 3 inches Flagstaff 2 to 4 inches Valle 0 to 1 inches Williams 1 to 3 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
